events.description: The release of the HCOB Germany Composite Purchasing Managers' Index for January 2026.

facts.fact_text: The HCOB Germany Composite PMI increased to 52.1 in January 2026 from 51.3 in December.

evidences.evidence_text: The HCOB Germany Composite PMI increased to 52.1 in January 2026 from 51.3 in December

facts.fact_text: Workforce numbers continued to decline in January.

evidences.evidence_text: Workforce numbers continued to decline, alongside further reductions in backlogs across both manufacturing and services.

facts.fact_text: Average input costs rose at the fastest pace in nearly three years.

evidences.evidence_text: average input costs rose at the fastest pace in nearly three years

claims.claim_text: A rebound in manufacturing production offset slower growth in services activity.
claims.author: HCOB

evidences.evidence_text: as a rebound in manufacturing production offset slower growth in services activity

claims.claim_text: Output charge inflation was driven mainly by higher service-sector prices.
claims.author: HCOB

evidences.evidence_text: output charge inflation jumped to a 23-month high, driven mainly by higher service-sector prices

claims.claim_text: Business sentiment reached its highest level since May 2024.

evidences.evidence_text: Business sentiment climbed to its highest level since May 2024.

evidence.evidence_text: as a rebound in manufacturing production offset slower growth in services activity
output charge inflation jumped to a 23-month high, driven mainly by higher service-sector prices
Total new business expanded for the third time in four months, supported by a broad stabilization in export sales.
